recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Crack the eggs into a bowl.
Whisk the eggs until well beaten.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and melt the butter.
Pour the beaten eggs into the pan and season with salt and pepper.
Cook the eggs, stirring occasionally, until they are softly set.
Remove from heat and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions: Wash and chop the romaine lettuce.
Grill the chicken breast until cooked through, then slice it into strips.
In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, chicken, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss to coat evenly.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Caprese Sandwich
instructions: Slice the ciabatta bread in half horizontally.
Drizzle olive oil on both sides of the bread.
Layer tomato slices, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves on the bottom half of the bread.
Season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle balsamic glaze on top of the ingredients.
Cover with the top half of the bread.
Press the sandwich together gently.
Cut into individual servings and serve.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, red wine, salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.
Simmer the sauce for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and dill.
Place the salmon fillets on the grill, skin side down.
Grill for 4-6 minutes per side, or until the salmon is cooked to your desired doneness.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the grilled salmon before serving.
